bug.cf_doc_type: If docs needed, set a value

long_desc.thetext:
Description of problem:
Atlas 3.10.2-13.fc25 from updates-testing breaks octave.
start octave-cli and then do for instance plot(rand(3))
After reverting to atlas.x86_64 3.10.2-12.fc24 it is ok.

Thanks for the report, but please also leave karma/feedback on the update:
https://bodhi.fedoraproject.org/updates/FEDORA-2016-6f9c9156c7

I think I've got this sorted. New build coming -
https://koji.fedoraproject.org/koji/taskinfo?taskID=16920427
atlas-3.10.2-14.fc25 has been submitted as an update to Fedora 25. https://bodhi.fedoraproject.org/updates/FEDORA-2016-1d3b1fc610
This is still not right. You got the base and sse3 builds swapped! (You are using -msse3 for base and -msse2 for sse3, which is backwards.)

I don't really understand what is going on with this, but there is no longer a sss3 package for x86_64.
These changes were part of:
commit 62670b4e6a58272b325dfb6962f65fccb28a3bf0 Author: Frantisek Kluknavsky <fkluknav@redhat.com> Date: Fri Sep 20 16:01:10 2013 +0200
Rebase to 3.10.1
- Dropped x86_64-SSE2, ix86-SSE1, ix86-3DNow, z10, z196 (uncompilable). - Modified incompatible patches. - Added armv7neon support, modified archdef from softfp abi to hard abi. - Modified Make.lib to include build-id, soname, versioned library name and symlinks. - Now builds monolithic libsatlas (serial) and libtatlas (threaded) libraries with lapack and blas included. - Lapack source tarball needed instead of static library. - Disabled cpu throttling detection again (sorry, could not work on atlas otherwise, feel free to enable yet again - atlas-throttling.patch). - Removed mentions of "Fedora" to promote redistribution. - Modified parts of atlas.spec sometimes left in place, work still in progress, cleanup needed.
So I'm taking it as intended that x86_64 is built with sse3.

atlas-3.10.2-14.fc25 has been pushed to the Fedora 25 testing repository. If problems still persist, please make note of it in this bug report. See https://fedoraproject.org/wiki/QA:Updates_Testing for instructions on how to install test updates. You can provide feedback for this update here: https://bodhi.fedoraproject.org/updates/FEDORA-2016-1d3b1fc610
atlas-3.10.2-14.fc25 has been pushed to the Fedora 25 stable repository. If problems still persist, please make note of it in this bug report.
